message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the application of coding techniques to enhance the robustness of network function virtualization (NFV) to hardware failure. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the algebraic structure of the encoded data frames, which suggests a possible fit with cs.IT (Information Theory). The use of coding for fault tolerance also relates to cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper proposes a new approach to NFV fault tolerance, which could be of interest to the distributed computing community, placing it in the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) category.
